intro: Leptorkis lutea, commonly known as the yellow dandelion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, yellow-green leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and gardens. Leptorkis lutea is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
